intro: Hieracium heterogynum subsp. ueskuebiense, commonly known as the Uskuebian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and other open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and genetic divergence from other hawkweed species.
